3.29.20  8:56 am   Is Mount St. Helens code for COVID-19?

     no

     And if not, why is it so accurate then?

     most of my songs are about 'earth', so it would make sense if you can find many parallels between my songs and what happens there

3.29.20  8:34 am   did you ever come back from new canaan

     yes

3.29.20  8:31 am   how do you manage to make so many tunes? i keep trying to make songs, but whenever i open up a music program, i can never think of anything original or nice or even bad, and i keep trying but it never happens, and then i get sad and cry and give up

     oh my gosh, you are very in need of a very critical piece of advice and life experience that i must tell you. i have become quite certain, at least for me, that i should NEVER attempt to write a song in the studio. by that i mean, do not attempt to write your song while the recording software/equipment is open. That doesn't mean you can't, but what i have found is that most of the time, if i try to write a song in the 'recording studio', the result is exactly what you just described. this is exactly why, after experimenting a little with the 'write in studio' approach somewhere around 2011, i came to a firm realization that i MUST write and finish the song BEFORE bringing it to the official recording environment. so so important. Recording a song, has enough unknowns and challenges. not even knowing how it goes is WAY too many unknowns. my policy is, i must know how it goes, i need to know every word, every melody, chords, and what's also particularly important to me is that i have the exact 'road map', which means know exactly how long everything goes -- no uncertainty about the ending, no uncertainty about transitions, intros, etc etc, no uncertainty about how it gets from point a to point b. the whole roadmap must be known from beginning to end. not necessary to have every little auxiliary detail, not even necessary to know all the exact instrumental parts. but, you just need the exact melody, lyric, chord, full road map. and also important to have an exact tempo marking, to avoid what i call a 'tempo crisis.' This is just what i've found. not knowing this will cause things to crumble in the studio, at least that is definitely the case when working by yourself. This is not necessarily true for everyone, and i'm sure this approach is more applicaple to people doing the entire arrangement on their own (like me, and perhaps you too). and i'm aware that many many many people write songs in the studio, and i'm sure some people can do it just fine, but i have become quite sure that, for me, without a shadow of a doubt, the 'write first' approach is a must for me, and after reading your story i would strongly advise this for you also. i hope this helps

3.29.20  8:21 am   do you like cold pizza?

     no

3.29.20  7:33 am   What's the weirdest but also probably harmless thing you've done/heard about in the past two weeks

     both the bpy tooltip and console output for brush strength of a grease pencil brush are bpy.data.brushes["Draw Pencil"].tool_settings.gpencil_paint.brush.gpencil_settings.pen_strength, and yet in reality the "tool_settings" attribute does not really exist there. the actual address, as can be found from searching the data api browser or poking around in auto-correct, is just bpy.data.brushes["Draw Pencil"].gpencil_settings.pen_strength

3.29.20  6:52 am   will there be a wfaoie 2

     yes, and more

3.29.20  6:34 am   in "i'm best friends with my own front door" why did you censor yourself?

     i did not, but i must admit, time was extremely limited because that was the first of a recurring series of experiments where i challenged myself to cut the overall production time down to less than 25% of what it had been before

3.29.20  6:24 am   why life exist

     i blame you

3.29.20  5:57 am   Do you use these questions as a way to stay sharp and engaged during periods of prolonged self-sequestration?

     it's one of the ways

     If so, is there a surrogate you can prescribe to the similarly isolated?

     i don't know what you mean by surrogate, but i would recommend finding ways to express yourself, either with language, visuals, music, or maybe something else i haven't thought of. it's very helpful if you can document your expressions somehow, because then you can keep a promise to yourself that others will see it sometime. then that is actually a remedy for isolation

3.29.20  5:53 am   Thank you for somehow managing to be both one of the most authentic and yet mysterious individuals on the internet

     thank you for your sudden outburst of friendliness

     how do i not own them when i do own them
